meanings.definition: Move toward or be attracted to a place or thing.
meanings.sent1: The planets are gravitating towards the sun.
meanings.sent2: I found myself gravitating towards the delicious smell of freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat couldn't resist gravitating towards the shiny toy.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes kept gravitating towards the stunning painting on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The magnet seemed to be gravitating all the metal objects in the room towards it.

meanings.sent1: The strong magnet was gravitating the iron filings towards it.
meanings.sent2: The charismatic leader had a way of gravitating people towards him.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious aura of the old house seemed to be gravitating visitors in.
meanings.sent4: His infectious laughter gravitated joy and happiness to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The gravitational pull of the black hole was gravitating everything in its path.
